summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated December 29, 2020, regarding the preparation of a case summary for the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution to be provided to a transition team. It contains a concise summary of the charges against Maxwell, her role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse scheme, and the case status as of late 2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged in a six-count indictment for facilitating the sexual abuse of three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and for committing perjury during a civil deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier whose sexual abuse of minor girls Maxwell is charged with facilitating; described as the central figure in the abuse scheme.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as playing a critical role in Epstein's scheme to sexually abuse minor girls by identifying, enticing, and grooming victims, and traveling with them to his residences.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged in a six-count indictment with facilitating the sexual abuse of three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's sexual abuse of three minor victims.

events.title: Bail Denial
events.description: The Court denied Maxwell's second bail motion, confirming her continued detention.

events.title: Scheduled Trial
events.description: Maxwell's trial was scheduled for July 2021 at the time of this correspondence.

events.title: Pretrial Motions Due
events.description: Pretrial motions in Maxwell's case were due in January 2021.

keyFacts: The document is an internal US Attorney's Office email preparing a summary of the Ghislaine Maxwell case for a 'transition' team, likely referring to the presidential transition in late 2020.
Maxwell was charged with a six-count indictment for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of three minor victims between 1994 and 1997, and for committing perjury.
The charges resulted from a multi-year investigation by the USAO-SDNY and FBI into Epstein and his co-conspirators.
Maxwell had been detained since her arrest, and the court had denied two separate bail motions, the most recent denial being on December 28, 2020.
Her trial was scheduled for July 2021 at the time of this correspondence.
